verses.verse: (Prayer for Protection from Enemies) To the leader. A Psalm of David. (Ps 55.2; 140.1) Hear my voice, O God, in my complaint; preserve my life from the dread enemy.
(Ps 56.6; 59.2) Hide me from the secret plots of the wicked, from the scheming of evildoers,
(Ps 58.7) who whet their tongues like swords, who aim bitter words like arrows,
(Ps 11.2; 55.19) shooting from ambush at the blameless; they shoot suddenly and without fear.
(Ps 10.11) They hold fast to their evil purpose; they talk of laying snares secretly, thinking, “Who can see us? (Syr Jerome: Heb them)
(Ps 49.11) Who can search out our crimes? (Cn: Heb They search out crimes) We have thought out a cunningly conceived plot.” For the human heart and mind are deep.
But God will shoot his arrow at them; they will be wounded suddenly.
(Ps 9.3; 22.7; Prov 18.7) Because of their tongue he will bring them to ruin; (Cn: Heb They will bring him to ruin, their tongue being against them) all who see them will shake with horror.
(Jer 50.28) Then everyone will fear; they will tell what God has brought about and ponder what he has done.
(Ps 25.20; 32.11) Let the righteous rejoice in the LORD and take refuge in him. Let all the upright in heart glory.
